tit.j: 京都府立山城総合運動公園
tit.e: Kyoto Prefectural Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports Park
Kyoto Prefectural Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports Park
Kyoto Prefectural Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports Park

sen.j: 山城総合運動公園（やましろそうごううんどうこうえん）は、京都府宇治市の運動公園。
sen.e: Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports park is located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports park is located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports park is located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 公園の愛称は「太陽が丘」と言い、府南部の府民からも「太陽が丘」として親しまれている。
sen.e: The park is commonly called "Taiyogaoka," and is known to citizens in the southern part of the prefecture as "Taiyogaoka."
The park is commonly called "Taiyogaoka," and is known to citizens in the southern part of the prefecture as "Taiyogaoka."
The park is commonly called "Taiyogaoka," and is known to citizens in the southern part of the prefecture as "Taiyogaoka."

sen.j: 公園の総面積は108ヘクタール。
sen.e: Its total area is 108 hectares.
Its total area is 108 hectares.
Its total area is 108 hectares.

sen.j: 年間100万人の利用者が訪れ、様々な大会などが行われている。
sen.e: A million people visit annually, and many events are held here.
1 million people visit annually, and many events are held here.
One million people visit annually, and many events are held here.
sen.cmt: 英数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 1978年（昭和53年）に京都府から計画がなされ、1980年から工事の起工が始まる。
sen.e: In 1978, the plan was made by Kyoto Prefecture, and in 1980, the construction work started.
In 1978, the plan for the Kyoto Prefectural Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports Park was created by Kyoto Prefecture, and construction started in 1980.
1978: The plan for the Kyoto Prefectural Yamashiro Comprehensive Sports Park was created by Kyoto Prefecture, and construction started in 1980.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）の「第43回国民体育大会」の京都府開催が開催されるため急ピッチで工事が進む。
sen.e: The construction work moved ahead at a fast pace so as to complete the park before the "43th National Sports" held in Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
Construction moved ahead quickly in order to complete the park before the "43th National Sports Event" held in Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
Construction moved ahead quickly in order to complete the park before the "43th National Sports Event" held in Kyoto Prefecture in 1988.
sen.cmt: 無駄な半角スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）には陸上競技場、第2競技場、第1野球場、公園センターなどの施設が完成し、一部の公園で開園された。
sen.e: In 1982, facilities such as athletics stadium, Daini stadium, Daiichi baseball stadium, and park center were completed, and the park was opened partially.
In 1982, facilities such as an athletics stadiums including the Daini stadium, the Daiichi baseball stadium, and a park center were completed, and the park was partially opened.
1982: Facilities such as an athletics stadiums including the Daini stadium, the Daiichi baseball stadium, and a park center were completed, and the park was partially opened.
sen.cmt: "In 1982, facilities" →"1982: Facilities" に変更しました。

sen.j: その後、練習用第2～第5野球場やプールなどが完成する。
sen.e: Thereafter, Daini to Daigo baseball stadiums for practice, and pool were completed.
Thereafter, construction of the Daini through Daigo baseball stadiums (literally, Number 1 through Number 5 baseball stadiums) (for practice) along with the pool were completed.
Thereafter, construction of the Daini through Daigo baseball stadiums (literally, Number 2 through Number 5 baseball stadiums) (for practice) along with the pool were completed.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）にはほぼ完成した。
sen.e: In 1992, the park was almost completed.
In 1992, the park was almost completed.
1992: The park was almost completed.
Taiyogaoka athletics stadium
Taiyogaoka athletics stadium
Taiyogaoka athletics stadium
Athletics and ball game ground
Athletics and ball game ground
Athletics and ball game ground

sen.j: サッカー・日本フットボールリーグの公式戦も開催される。
sen.e: Football games and official football games for the Japan Football League are also held here.
Football games and official football games for the Japan Football League are also held here.
Football games and official football games for the Japan Football League are also held here.
Summary of facilities
Summary of facilities
Summary of facilities

sen.j: 日本陸上競技連盟第2種公認
sen.e: Authorized as Category 2 Athletics Stadium by the Japan Association of Athletics Federations
Authorized as Category 2 Athletics Stadium by the Japan Association of Athletics Federations
Authorized as Category 2 Athletics Stadium by the Japan Association of Athletics Federations
Track: 400m x 8 lanes
Track: 400m x 8 lanes
Track: 400m x 8 lanes
Natural grass ground
Natural grass ground
Natural grass ground

sen.j: 収容人員 メインスタンド：1,800人、芝生スタンド：5,200人 計7,000人
sen.e: Capacity: 1,800 people for the main stand, 5,200 people for the grass stand: 7,000 people in total
Capacity: 1,800 people for the main stand, 5,200 people for the grass stand: 7,000 people in total
Capacity: 1,800 people for the main stand, 5,200 people for the grass stand: 7,000 people in total

sen.j: 京阪バス、京阪宇治バス 太陽が丘（公園構内）、太陽が丘ゲート前、太陽が丘西ゲート前下車
sen.e: The nearest bus stops are Taiyogaoka (on the premises of the park), Taiyogaokageto-mae (in front of Taiyogaoka gate) and Taiyogaokanishigeto-mae by Keihan Bus and Keihan Uji Bus.
The nearest bus stops are Taiyogaoka (on the premises of the park), Taiyogaokageto-mae (in front of Taiyogaoka gate) and Taiyogaokanishigeto-mae by Keihan Bus and Keihan Uji Bus.
The nearest bus stops are Taiyogaoka (on the premises of the park), Taiyogaokageto-mae (in front of Taiyogaoka gate) and Taiyogaokanishigeto-mae by Keihan Bus and Keihan Uji Bus.
